Live Statistics Overview

  • Explanation:
  • 1.  In accordance with the regulations approved by the Resolution No. 300 of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated June 2, 2022, on the procedure for awarding state grants to talented students of “New Uzbekistan” University, the following categories of students will be granted 4-year state grants:
    1. Graduates of the Presidential Schools within the system of the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions who hold a “Cambridge International AS & A Level” certificate.
    2. Graduates of the Presidential Schools within the system of the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions who hold a “Cambridge International AS & A Level” certificate.
    3. Graduates of the Presidential Schools within the system of the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions who hold a “Cambridge International AS & A Level” certificate.
    4. Graduates of the Presidential Schools within the system of the Agency for Specialized Educational Institutions who hold a “Cambridge International AS & A Level” certificate.
  • 2. No separate quotas will be allocated in advance for graduates of Presidential Schools, applicants included in the “Unified Register of Social Protection”, and international Olympiad winners. After these applicants          secure a place through the general admission process, these places will be reflected in the “Reserved” column for the respective field of study in the table above.
  • When places are reserved under this procedure, the number of available quotas for tuition-fee basis and/or tiered state grants within the total admission quota for the respective field of study will be proportionally reduced.

Rank Group (for each field of study)

State Grant Quota (relative to the total admission quota for each field of study)

State Grant Funding per Applicant

Group 1

Group 2

Group 3

Group 1

Group 2

Group 3

Group 1

Group 2

Group 3

The allocation of tiered 1-year state grants will be reviewed annually by the University based on the specified criteria, and grants will be awarded to eligible applicants in accordance with the established procedure.    4. The total admission quota for each field of study may be adjusted by the Admissions Commission based on the number of applicants and their requests. In this case, the number of state grants and tuition-fee places will be adjusted proportionally.    5. Since the statistical data on the admission process for applicants in the table above is updated in real-time, it is recommended to monitor this table regularly.
